content: I understand Kotlin is all the hype now, but I don’t see how investing in a language not supported by Google for a long term project is a wise decision. It’s not. It’s very risky. And the fact that not many developers know about Kotlin is another issue. There’s already a shortage of experienced Android developers. So finding developers to maintain a Kotlin codebase will be even more complicated. That article is wishful thinking. You’re trying to convince developers to follow you and back your decision. That’s what it is. For me, that’s a no until Google supports it officially and actively at the very least.
